Metadata Requests

Requests for SMuFL metadata files are handled in the request module. The Request class allows simultanous URL and filepath requests for maximum reliability and access to updated data.

exception URLWarning[source]

URL connection failure warning.

class Request(path=None, fallback=None, mode='r', encoding='utf-8', warn=True)[source]

HTTP or filesystem request.

A fallback path (e.g., a filesystem path to the same file), may be specified in case of connection failure (urllib.error.URLError) if the primary path is a URL.

An optional warning may be raised in the event of a fallback.

Parameters:

  • path (Path | str | None) – Primary URL or filepath.

  • fallback (Path | str | None) – Fallback filepath to use if path raises URLError.

  • mode (str) – File usage specification. See open() for details.

  • encoding (str) – File text encoding. See open() for details. Defaults to [request] encoding configuration.

  • warn (bool) – Warn if URLError is raised before fallback request. Defaults to [request] warn configuration.

json()[source]

Parse request as JSON.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

property encoding: str

File text encoding.

property fallback: str | None

Fallback URL or filepath as string.

property mode: str

File usage specification.

property path: str | None

Primary URL or filepath as string.

property raw: str | bytes

Makes a request and returns raw file contents.
